      • Button

        public Button(java.lang.String text,
              int left,
              int top,
              int width,
              int height)
        Default button constructor
        Parameters:
        text - text to be displayed in the button
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top
        width - width of the button
        height - height of the button

      • Button

        public Button(int left,
              int top,
              net.minecraft.util.ResourceLocation icon,
              int iconU,
              int iconV,
              int iconWidth,
              int iconHeight)
        Creates a button with an image inside. The size of the button is based on the size of the image with 3 pixels of padding.
        Parameters:
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top
        icon - the icon resource location
        iconU - the u position on the resource
        iconV - the v position on the resource
        iconWidth - width of the icon
        iconHeight - height of the icon

      • Button

              int iconU,
              int iconV,
              int iconWidth,
              int iconHeight)
        Creates a button with an image inside. The size of the button is based on the size of the image with 3 pixels of padding.
        Parameters:
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top
        width - width of the button
        height - height of the button
        icon - the icon resource location
        iconU - the u position on the resource
        iconV - the v position on the resource
        iconWidth - width of the icon
        iconHeight - height of the icon

                   float partialTicks)

        The main render loop. This is where you draw your component.
        Specified by:
        render in class Component
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Laptop instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)
        partialTicks - percentage passed in-between two ticks

        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
